newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam executes man convicted of rape and murder.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam executes man convicted of rape and murder.

text.p: A court offficial in Vietnam's northern province of Lao Cai said on Wednesday that a local man had been executed for the rape and murder of his sister-in-law.
She said Ha Van Dan, 26, went before the firing squad on November 29 after his appeal against the death penalty was turned down by the president.
Dan was found guilty of dragging his brother's wife out of her house, raping her on a nearby hill and then, fearing she would denounce him, beating her to death with a flashlight.
Executions are not normally reported in Vietnam.
According to official media reports, 104 people were sentenced to death in 1995. But only 11 executions were officially reported during the course of that year.
